metadata.title: CVE-2023-29400 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Templates containing actions in unquoted HTML attributes (e.g."attr={{.}}") executed with empty input can result in output withunexpected results when parsed due to HTML normalization rules. This mayallow injection of arbitrary attributes into tags.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.19 - 1.19.8-1ubuntu0.1
golang-1.19-go - 1.19.8-1ubuntu0.1
golang-1.19-src - 1.19.8-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

golang-1.20 - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1
golang-1.20-go - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1
golang-1.20-src - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.19 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.19.8-1ubuntu0.1').
golang-1.20 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1').
